clinical_study.brief_title: Optimization and Follow-up of the Consecutive Use of Two Intragastric Balloons in the Treatment of Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Optimization and Follow-up of the Consecutive Use of Two Intragastric Balloons (Heliosphere Bag®) in the Treatment of Obesity: A Prospective Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a cohort study with the objective of describing during a 12-month follow-up, weight loss in obese patients submitted to treatment using two consecutively air-filled IGB (Heliosphere® 600 cc and Heliosphere 720 cc) without any interval between the removal of the first and the placement of the second.

primary_outcome.description: Subtraction of the Final body mass index (BMI ) after 12 months of IGB placement minus the initial BMI

secondary_outcome.description: Rate of patients in which the balloon was extracted early

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through endoscopy completion, an average of 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of complications during the placement of the balloon
Arterial blood pressure will be measured before and after IGB using an digital sphygmomanometer
Blood measurements of Glycated hemoglobin (HbAq1c) will be reported in International Federation of Clinical Chemistry and Laboratory Medicine Units
Physical activity will be self-reported on a weekly basis
Caloric intake will be self-reported on a weekly basis
Measure that relates the preoperative weight, the postoperative weight and ideal weight

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through posToperative period completion, an average of 72 hours after the termination of surgery

arm_group.description: Obese patients submitted to treatment using two consecutively air-filled IGB (Heliosphere® 600 cc and Heliosphere 720 cc) without any interval between the removal of the first and the placement of the second.

intervention.description: Weight loss system that consists of an air balloon that occupies space in the stomach, thus reducing the gastric capacity and leaving less volume for food.

study_pop.textblock: Obese or overweight individuals eligible for gastric balloon placement and with no contraindications for the procedure will be recruited from the Mario Covas Hospital and the Kaiser Day Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Class I obesity (30-34.9 kg/m2), Class II obesity (35-39.5 kg/m2) or overweight (25-29.9 kg/m2).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Morbid obesity (BMI>40kg/m2), operative contraindications.
